intro: Pityrodia exserta var. lanata, commonly known as the woolly mistflower, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage that gives it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in spring, adding ornamental value to its appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in sandy or rocky habitats. Due to its unique appearance and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its aesthetic appeal.
